content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/search_strands_20260128/Rorledning is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
I'll help you migrate the Java 8 codebase to Java 17. Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

First, I'll:
1. View the repository structure
2. Check the current Java version in pom.xml or build files
3. Identify dependencies that need to be updated
4. Make necessary changes to support Java 17
5. Test the build with `mvn clean verify`

Let's start by exploring the repository.

Let me check the pom.xml file to see the current configuration:

File content displayed in console.
Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>com.intellectualsites</groupId>
    <artifactId>Pipeline</artifactId>
    <version>1.5.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <packaging>jar</packaging>
    <inceptionYear>2020</inceptionYear>
    <licenses>
        <license>
            <name>MIT License</name>
            <url>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Sauilitired/Rörledning/master/LICENSE</url>
        </license>
    </licenses>
    <name>Rörledning</name>
    <description>Services for Java</description>
    <properties>
        <java.version>1.8</java.version>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
    </properties>
    <distributionManagement>
        <repository>
            <id>intellectualsites</id>
            <name>IntellectualSites</name>
            <url>https://mvn.intellectualsites.com/content/repositories/releases</url>
        </repository>
        <snapshotRepository>
            <id>intellectualsites-snapshots</id>
            <name>IntellectualSites Snapshots</name>
            <url>https://mvn.intellectualsites.com/content/repositories/snapshots</url>
        </snapshotRepository>
    </distributionManagement>
    <build>
        <defaultGoal>clean package</defaultGoal>
        <resources>
            <resource>
                <directory>src/main/resources</directory>
                <filtering>true</filtering>
            </resource>
        </resources>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.8.1</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>${java.version}</source>
                    <target>${java.version}</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-deploy-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>2.8.2</version>
                <configuration>
                    <skip>true</skip>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.sonatype.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>nexus-staging-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>1.6.8</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>default-deploy</id>
                        <phase>deploy</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>deploy</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
                <configuration>
                    <serverId>intellectualsites</serverId>
                    <nexusUrl>https://mvn.intellectualsites.com/</nexusUrl>
                    <skipStaging>true</skipStaging>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.2.0</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>attach-javadocs</id>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>jar</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-source-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.2.1</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>attach-sources</id>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>jar</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>2.22.2</version>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit-jupiter-engine</artifactId>
            <version>5.6.2</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.google.code.findbugs</groupId>
            <artifactId>jsr305</artifactId>
            <version>3.0.2</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.google.guava</groupId>
            <artifactId>guava</artifactId>
            <version>29.0-jre</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>
</project>

Let me check a few more files to understand the code structure:
The code uses `javax.annotation.Nonnull` which is provided by the jsr305 dependency, so that should be fine. Now let's try to build the project to see if there are any issues:

input.file_text:
# Java 17 Migration Summary

## Overview
The codebase has been successfully migrated from Java 8 to Java 17.

## Changes Made

### 1. Java Version Update
- **Changed:** `java.version` property from `1.8` to `17`
- **Location:** `pom.xml` properties section

### 2. Maven Compiler Plugin
- **Updated:** Version from `3.8.1` to `3.11.0`
- **Added:** `<release>17</release>` configuration for better Java 17 compatibility
- **Purpose:** Ensures proper compilation with Java 17 features and bytecode

### 3. Maven Surefire Plugin
- **Updated:** Version from `2.22.2` to `3.2.2`
- **Purpose:** Better JUnit 5 support and Java 17 compatibility

### 4. Maven Javadoc Plugin
- **Updated:** Version from `3.2.0` to `3.6.3`
- **Purpose:** Java 17 compatible documentation generation

### 5. Dependency Updates

#### JUnit Jupiter
- **Updated:** From `5.6.2` to `5.11.0`
- **Purpose:** Latest stable version with full Java 17 support

#### Google Guava
- **Updated:** From `29.0-jre` to `33.0.0-jre`
- **Purpose:** Latest version with Java 17 enhancements and fixes

#### JSR305 (FindBugs Annotations)
- **Kept:** Version `3.0.2` (already compatible)
- **Purpose:** Provides `@Nonnull` and other annotations

## Verification Results

### Build Status
✅ **SUCCESS** - `mvn clean verify` passes successfully

### Test Results
- **Tests Run:** 10
- **Failures:** 0
- **Errors:** 0
- **Skipped:** 0
- **Time Elapsed:** 0.065s

### Environment
- **Java Version:** OpenJDK 17.0.17
- **Maven Version:** 3.9.6
- **Build Tool:** Apache Maven

## Code Compatibility

### No Code Changes Required
The existing Java code is fully compatible with Java 17. The codebase uses:
- Standard Java 8 features (lambdas, streams, Optional)
- JSR305 annotations (`@Nonnull`)
- Google Guava collections and utilities

All of these are fully supported in Java 17 without any modifications.

## Benefits of Java 17

### Performance Improvements
- Better garbage collection
- Improved JIT compiler optimizations
- Reduced memory footprint

### Security
- Long-Term Support (LTS) release
- Latest security patches and updates

### Language Features Available (if needed in future)
- Sealed classes
- Pattern matching for switch
- Records
- Text blocks
- Enhanced pseudo-random number generators
- And more...

## Next Steps (Optional Enhancements)

While not required, the codebase could benefit from:
1. Using Java 17 record types for immutable data classes
2. Utilizing sealed classes for better type safety
3. Leveraging pattern matching in switch statements
4. Using text blocks for multi-line strings

## Conclusion

The migration to Java 17 is **complete and successful**. All tests pass, and the build generates artifacts without errors. The project is now running on a modern, supported LTS version of Java with improved performance and security.

I have successfully migrated the Java 8 codebase at `/tmp/workdir/search_strands_20260128/Rorledning` to Java 17. Here's what was done:

### ✅ Changes Made:

4. **Maven Javadoc Plugin**: Upgraded from `3.2.0` to `3.6.3`
5. **Dependencies Updated**:
   - JUnit Jupiter: `5.6.2` → `5.11.0`
   - Google Guava: `29.0-jre` → `33.0.0-jre`

✓ Errors: 0
